Comments_List: Creative use of a greater number of grammatical structures was improved, along with significant advances made in pronunciation.
Developed Japanese reading, writing, and speaking skills.
The number of kanji assigned swelled to the point of being impossible to memorize, so perhaps more review rather than constant addition of new characters could be beneficial.
Some of the kanji learned seemed irrelevant in a real-world context (kanji that we probably wouldn't actually use in a real-life situation).
I've you've made it this far through Yale's Japanese curriculum, you know exactly what you're getting yourself into.
Yes. A language course very helpful for those who would like to develop everyday language skill for all occasions.
Yes, the teachers area great and while the course load is a lot, if you work hard, it is doable.
